snippet: A former human rights lawyer and close ally of the late President Roh Moo-hyun was chosen Sunday as the main opposition Democratic United Party’s candidate for December’s election.
abstract: South Korea's main opposition Democratic United Party nominates Moon Jae-in, former human rights lawyer and ally of former Pres Roh Moo-hyun, as its candidate for president; Moon is expected to enter talks with independent Ahn Cheol-soo to decide who will represent the broader liberal camp to challenge the conservative governing party's candidate Park Geun-hye.
lead_paragraph: A former human rights lawyer and close ally of the late President Roh Moo-hyun was chosen Sunday as the main opposition Democratic United Party’s candidate for December’s election.

headline.seo: South Korean Opposition Picks Moon Jae-in as Its Candidate
headline.main: Opposition Makes Pick in South Korea
headline.print_headline: Opposition Makes Pick In South Korea
